main event: An American Airlines pilot observed a large aerial object approaching Las Vegas, Nevada, on March 9, 1955.
interesting points: The object was reported to have no contrails and changed course while moving at high speed., Visibility was poor during the observation., The pilot estimated the distance from the plane to the object was approximately 15-20 miles., The sighting lasted for about 30 minutes., The report concludes there was insufficient data to definitively identify the object.
